intro: Mammea eugenioides var. crepitans, commonly known as the crackling mammea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, orange-red flowers. The plant produces distinctive, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in lowland forests or along stream banks. Its unique fruiting habit and ornamental value make it a notable species in botanical collections.
